thread.title: North East's quickest growing companies unveiled at Fastest 50 event

author: Graeme Whitfield
title: North East's quickest growing companies unveiled at Fastest 50 event
text:
North East's quickest growing companies unveiled at Fastest 50 event Annual Ward Hadaway event saw Killingworth firm NBT Group revealed as region's fastest growing business Share Ward Hadaway and The Journal North East Fastest 50 Awards 2018 held at the Baltic, Gateshead (Image: Newcastle Chronicle) Get business updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Tyneside stock control and procurement firm NBT Group has been revealed as the region’s fastest growing company after taking the overall crown at the annual Fastest 50 awards.
The event, organised by Newcastle law firm Ward Hadaway with support from The Journal, saw the North East’s fastest growing 50 companies celebrated at the Baltic art gallery in Gateshead.
The Killingworth company, which dates back to 1908, had earlier been named the fastest growing medium-sized business in the region, beating SLW (Holdings) of Sunderland and Stockton’s IDEC Technical Services Limited. Toby Bridges who represents the overall business winner, NBT Integrated Services (Image: Newcastle Chronicle)
Boldon’s Total Resources (UK) was revealed as the fastest growing small company, ahead of Tyneside Group and Hexham and Northern Marts, while Newcastle clothing retailer End taking the prize for large firms, beating Alnwick construction firm Cussins and Gateshead’s Templeman Trading.
Accepting the prize, NBT chief executive Toby Bridges said: “This is absolutely mindblowing. We’re 110 years old so growth can come at any time - ambition isn’t necessarily about today or tomorrow. L-R David McDaid, Nigel Watson, Toby Bridges, Jamie Martin and Les Thompson (Image: Newcastle Chronicle)
“The growth hasn’t come because of what I’ve done, it’s the team that sits next to me. We’ve got an amazing board and a great team. To be standing here, I can’t believe it, given all the talent in this room.”
The Fastest 50, which Ward Hadaway has been running since 1998, ranks the fastest growing profitable companies in the North East over the last three years. Graeme Whitfield, Business Editor, The Journal & The Gazette (Image: Newcastle Chronicle)
This year’s list contains companies from around the region operating in a number of sectors.
The prizes were awarded by Ward Hadaway senior partner Jamie Martin, who said: “The region is a tremendous place to grow business, to invest and innovate, but we recognise that it has been a challenging and uncertain time for North East businesses. Winner of the Fastest growing small business, Total Resources (UK) Limited. L-R Les Thompson, Nigel Watson, John Smart, Jamie Martin and Paul Thompson (Image: Newcastle Chronicle)
“Brexit is just six months away and companies are finding it difficult to invest and grow; planning ahead is difficult. To see so many companies do just that speaks volumes about the commitment of our business community to grow successful and dynamic companies.”
The awards ceremony also heard from guest speaker Nigel Watson, information services director at Northumbrian Water, who told the audience about how his company’s much-praised annual Innovation Festival had been made possible by being in the North East. He said: “There’s something in this region about how friendly it is, but also a humility and openness to ideas, a sense of valuing collaboration and wanting to be part of something bigger.
“That’s really a key attribute that we should all consider of value to the country. In terms of where we find ourselves right now, allowing your customers and partners into the kitchen, being transparent and open is a great quality to break the lack of trust evident between some organisations and consumers.” Like us on Facebook
